content.description: Crimpy and long moves.  Very pumpy.
content.protection: A traverse from the left that comes into the rhyno dyno.

content.description:
Find the stance near the middle of "

Go Feed the Dogs

" on the right side (downstream section) Â about 8 feet up, and continue past the stance with undercling and a long high reach left.
content.location:
This is near the middle of "

Go Feed the Dogs

" on the right side (downstream section). It is four feet to the left of

Honor

.

content.description: One of several great seam problems on the leftmost face of the Sanctuary. Start with a good right fingerlock and a large foot ledge and work up sloping laybacks and crimps to a good hold a few feet below the lip. The topout is easy but about 18 feet off the ground.
content.protection: A pad or two and spotters depending on your comfort level; the crux moves are easily protectable with a single pad. Good landing except for a couple trees a few feet back.
content.location: The leftmost wall of the Sanctuary is cut by several vertical seams. This problem follows the second one from the right.

content.description:
A very good eliminate. Sinister Minister climbs the line of crimps between

Threat Condition Delta

and

Feel The Wetness

without using the holds in the seams. Finish up on good holds at the top. Long reaches between excellent smooth crimps mean fun for everyone!
content.location: On the leftmost face of the Sanctuary, there is a line of crimps between the second and third seams from the right. Climb it.

content.description:
Start as for

Devil's Face

, and traverse right on very thin crimps into the layback problem. It's harder the higher you go.
content.location:
Do the same start as

Devil's Face

.

content.description: A fun moderate and warmup. Pick your way up from the left side of the low roof to the line of layback holds and follow it to the top.
content.protection: A pad or two and spotter. Good landing.
content.location: Right of the dihedral in the center of the wall is a low roof. This problem starts on its left side and trends up and left.

content.description:
From the 2009 Rock Climbing St. Vrain Canyons guidebook authored by Bernard Gillett:

This is the thin seam and face left of

Feel the Wetness

(the fifth crack from the arete). Technical footwork, precise hand placement guard this hidden gem.
content.location: Begin with your left hand in the fifth crack from the arete and your right hand on a large pinch. Find the sequence, and climb up.

content.description: Layback the crack in the obvious dihedral on the right side of the Sanctuary Wall.  You can also use the juggy ledges to the right of the crack.  This is a very good warm-up to loosen up those sausage fingers you get from the 25-minute hike in.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the Sanctuary Wall.

content.description: From the two hand holds, move up for the hold next to the loose block on the right, make another long reach, then continue straight up.
content.location:
Near middle of the right face of

Go Feed the Dogs

are two square 3 inch hand holds close together about 7 feet up, four feet to the right of the route

Truth

. See the picture of the route

Truth

.

content.description: Traverse either right or left, right most section of the cliff. 5.10 moves with several rests and 2 5.11 cruxes.
content.location: Start at "Lichen in you Eye" and continue right.

content.description: A fun problem with a couple of powerful moves. Follow opposing sidepulls in the twin cracks to a large undercling, then power up to a good but far away incut (there are a couple of intermediates to help.) Shorter folks may have trouble with this reachy crux move. Top out on jugs.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter. Like most of the Sanctuary, the landing is good but the topout is high.
content.location: The leftmost face of the Sanctuary is cut with several vertical seams. This problem follows the third and fourth ones from the right.

content.description: Layback the positive holds in the dihedral crack to many large holds at the top. This is a good warmup problem that tends to get a bit dirty.
content.location: The crack in the obvious dihedral in the center of the wall.

content.description: This is a stellar problem following crimpy slashes up an otherwise blank face. Pull thin edges to two perfect small crimps, crank to the horizontal and top out on massive horns.
content.protection: 1+ pad. The topout is high but very easy.
content.location: The face just right of the dihedral in the center of the wall. The holds in the dihedral crack and on the wall to the left are off.

content.description: The enticing arÃªte problem near the middle of the Sanctuary. Sit start on good sloping holds and climb up through more slopers and crimps to a reach to the bomber lip (it's longer than it looks.) Great fun!
content.protection: A pad or two and a spot would be good.
content.location: On the arete splitting the dihedral area and the left wall of the Sanctuary. Walk off.

pathTokens: North Fork of the St. Vrain River
